title: Wheatstone Bridge
description: A Wheatstone bridge is an electrical circuit used to measure an unknown electrical resistance by balancing two legs of a bridge circuit, one leg of which includes the unknown component.

title: Maxwell Bridge
description: A Maxwell bridge is a modification of the Wheatstone bridge used to measure an unknown inductance in terms of calibrated resistance and capacitance.

title: Schering Bridge
description: A Schering bridge is a bridge circuit used for measuring the capacitance of a capacitor. It is also known as a capacitance bridge.

title: Anderson Bridge
description: An Anderson bridge is a bridge circuit used for measuring the self-inductance of a coil. It is also known as an inductance bridge.

title: Owen Bridge
description: An Owen bridge is a bridge circuit used for measuring the mutual inductance between two coils.

title: Wiens Series Bridge
description: A Wiens Series Bridge is a bridge circuit used for measuring the capacitance of a capacitor.

title: Wien Robinson Bridge
description: A Wien Robinson Bridge is a bridge circuit used for measuring the capacitance of a capacitor.
